Outputs.1: Audio track added and saved to temporary file

AudioAddTrack.Description: Adds a new audio track to the video file, all other audio tracks will remain.  This will use the first audio track of the file as the source audio track to convert.

Fields.Index-Help: The index where to insert the new audio track.  0 based, so to insert the new audio track as the first track set this to 0.
Fields.Channels-Help: The number of channels to convert this audio track to.
Fields.Bitrate-Help: Bitrate of the new audio track

Outputs.1: Audio tracks volume was adjusted and saved to temporary file

AudioAdjustVolume.Description: Adjusts audio tracks volume in a video file using FFMPEG

Fields.VolumePercent-Help:
The percent of the adjusted volume.
100 means no adjustment
50 means half volume
0 means muted

Outputs.1: Audio tracks were normalized and saved to temporary file
Outputs.2: No audio tracks were found to be normalized

AudioNormalization.Description: Normalizes all audio tracks in a video file using FFMPEGs loudnorm filter

Fields.AllAudio-Help: If all audio tracks should be normalized or if just the first track should be
Fields.TwoPass-Help: If the audio tracks should use two pass normalization.  This improves the normalization but increases the processing time.
Fields.Pattern-Help: An optional regular expression to filter out audio tracks to normalize.  Will match against the title, codec and language
Fields.NotMatching-Help: If the pattern should be used to exclude audio tracks from normalization, otherwise if the audio track matches they will be normalized.

AudioTrackRemover.Description:
Allows you to remove audio tracks based on either their title or their language codes.

Any title (or language code if set to "Use Language Code") that is blank will NOT be removed regardless of the pattern.

Fields.Pattern-Help: A regular expression to match against, eg "commentary" to remove commentary tracks
Fields.NotMatching-Help: If audio tracks NOT matching the pattern should be removed
Fields.UseLanguageCode-Help: If the language code of the audio track should be used instead of the title

Outputs.1: Audio tracks re-ordered in new temporary file

AudioTrackReorder.Description:
Allows you to reorder audio tracks in the preferred order.

Enter the languages/audio codecs/channels in the order you want.  Any not listed will be ordered after the ones entered in their original order.
If there are multiple tracks with same language/codec/channels, they will be ordered first by the order you entered, then in their original order.

Output 1: Tracks were reordered
Output 2: Tracks did not need reordering

Fields.OrderedTracks-Help: The order of audio codecs to the audio tracks by.  This is done after the languages (if any)
Fields.Languages-Help: The order of languages to sort the audio tracks by.  This sorting is done before the codec.
Fields.Channels-Help:
The order of audio channels to sort the audio tracks by.  This sorting is done before languages.
For example "5.1","7.1","6.2","2"

AudioTrackSetLanguage.Label: Audio Set Language

Outputs.1: Audio tracks updated to new temporary file

AudioTrackSetLanguage.Description:
Allows you to set the language for any audio tracks that have no language set.  If the audio track does have a language set, it will be skipped.

Output 1: Audio Tracks were updated
Output 2: No audio tracks were needing to be updated

AutoChapters.Description: Automatically detect scene changes in the video to generate chapters.

Outputs.1: Chapters generated and saved to temporary file
Outputs.2: No chapters detected or video already had chapters

Fields.MinimumLength-Help: The minimum length of a chapter in seconds
Fields.Percent-Help: The threshold percentage value to use for scene detection changes.  A good value is 45%

ComskipChapters.Description: Uses a comskip EDL file and will create chapters given that EDL comskip file.

Outputs.1: Commercials chapters created, saved to temporary file

DetectBlackBars.Description:
Processes a video file and scans for black bars in the video.

If found a parameter "VideoCrop" will be added.

Output 1: Black bars detected
Output 2: Not detected

Fields.CroppingThreshold-Help: The amount of pixels that must be greater than to crop.   E.g. if there's only 5 pixels detected as black space, you may consider this too small to crop.

FFMPEG.Description:
The node lets you run any FFMPEG command you like.  Giving you full control over what it can do.

For more information refer to the FFMPEG documentation

Fields.Extension-Help: The file extension to use on the newly created file
Fields.CommandLine-Help:
The command line to run with FFMPEG.
'{WorkingFile}': the working file of the flow
'{Output}': The output file that will be passed as the last parameter to FFMPEG including the extension defined above.

RemuxToMKV.Descritption: Remuxes a video file into a MKV container.  All streams will be copied to the new container

Outputs.2: File was already in a MKV container

Fields.Force-Help:
If the file should be always remuxed into a MKV container even when it already is in a MKV container.
i.e. a new temporary file will always be created.

RemuxToMP4.Descritption: Remuxes a video file into a MP4 container.  All streams will be copied to the new container

Outputs.2: File was already in a MP4 container

Fields.Force-Help:
If the file should be always remuxed into a MP4 container even when it already is in a MP4 container.
i.e. a new temporary file will always be created.

SubtitleRemover.Description:
Removes subtitles from a video file if found.

Output 1: Subtitles were removed
Output 2: No subtitles found that needed to be removed

Outputs.1: Subtitles removed in new temporary file

Fields.RemoveAll-Help: When checked, all subtitles will be removed from the file, otherwise only those selected below will be

SubtitleLanguageRemover.Description:
Allows you to remove subtitles based on either their title or their language codes.

Any language (or title if set to "Use Title") that is blank will NOT be removed regardless of the pattern.

Fields.Pattern-Help: A regular expression to match against, eg "eng" to remove English tracks
Fields.NotMatching-Help: If subtitles NOT matching the pattern should be removed
Fields.UseTitle-Help: If the title of the subtitle should be used for matching instead of the language

VideoCodec.Description:
This node will check the codecs in the input file, and trigger when matched.

Output 1: Matches
Output 2: Does not match

Fields.Codecs-Help:
Enter a list of case insensitive video or audio codecs.
Eg hevc, h265, mpeg4, ac3

VideoEncode.Description:
A generic video encoding node, this lets you customize how to encode a video file using ffmpeg.

Output 1: Video was processed
Output 2: No processing required

Fields.Extension-Help: The file extension to use on the newly created file.
Fields.VideoCodec-Help:
The video codec the video should be in, for example hevc, h264.
If left empty all original video tracks will be copied.
Fields.VideoCodecParameters-Help: The parameters to use to encode the video, eg. "hevc_nvenc -preset hq -crf 23" to encode into hevc using the HQ preset a constant rate factor of 23 and using NVIDIA hardware acceleration.
Fields.AudioCodec-Help:
The audio codec to encode the video with.
If left empty all original audio tracks will be copied.
Fields.Language-Help: Optional [ISO 639-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_ISO_639-2_codes) language code to use.  Will attempt to find an audio track with this language code if not the best audio track will be used.

VideoHasStream.Description: Tests if a video file contains a stream

Outputs.2: Does not contain the matching stream

Fields.Stream-Help: The type of stream to look for
Fields.Title: Title
Fields.Title-Help: A regular expression used to test the stream title
Fields.Codec-Help: A regular expression used to test the stream codec
Fields.Language-Help: A regular expression used to test the stream language
Fields.Channels-Help: The number of channels to test for.  Set to 0 to ignore this check

VideoScaler.Description: This allows you to scale a video to the specified dimensions.  It will retain the aspect ratio of the video so if the video was 1920x1000 it would scale to 1280x668 if you select 720P.

Outputs.2: Video was already in/near the scaled resolution

Fields.Language-Help: The video codec to encode the scaled video in
Fields.Extension-Help: The file extension to use on the newly created file
Fields.Force-Help: When checked the video will be force scaled even if the working file is already in this resolution (or near this resolution).
Fields.VideoCodecParameters-Help: The parameters to use to encode the video, eg. "hevc_nvenc -preset hq -crf 23" to encode into hevc using the HQ preset a constant rate factor of 23 and using NVIDIA hardware acceleration.
